column2: Stylometry";"This is a web-based text reading and analysis environment. It is a scholarly project that is designed to facilitate reading and interpretive practices for digital humanities students and scholars as well as for the general public. #SEPIt is possible to upload one's own corpus with this tool.#SEPThe interface is available in a number of languages. An online user guide is available. ";"GPL3 (code)";;"Arabic

column1: Concordancer of Corpus Hedendaags Nederlands (Corpus of Contemporary Dutch) ;"https://chn.ivdnt.org/";"Querying/concordancing";"This is a dedicated query tool
column3: for Corpus Hedendaags Nederlands (Corpus of Contemporary Dutch)
column7: news broadcasts and legal writings (1814–2013).#SEPThe corpus is a combination of the 5
column8: 27 and 38 million word corpora and the PAROLE Corpus
column9: supplemented with newspaper texts from NRC and De Standaard (until 2013).#SEPRegistration is required for using this tool. Shibboleth log-in is supported.";;;"Dutch";"Corpus query tools";;;"External";;;;

column1: PaQu;"https://paqu.let.rug.nl:8068/";"Querying/concordancing (treebanks)";"This is an application for searching in treebanks (i.e. text corpora in which each sentence has been assigned a syntactic structure) and for analysing the search results. #SEPIt is possible to upload one's own corpus with this tool
column2: for which registration is required.";;;"Dutch";"Corpus query tools";;;"External";;;"Odijk et al. (2017)";"https://doi.org/10.5334/bbi.23"

column1: CoANZSE Audio;"https://coanzse.org/landing/index.html";"Querying/concordancing";"This is a dedicated concordancer for the Corpus of Australian and New Zealand Spoken English.#SEPThe corpus contains 195 million words of geolocated automatic speech recognition transcripts of video content from local governments in Australia and New Zealand
column2: created for the study of lexical
column5: and discourse-pragmatic phenomena of spoken language. Additionally
column6: the corpus contains complete textual content of the corpus
column7: audio files and forced alignments in Praat's TextGrid format for most transcripts.#SEPThe corpus can be accessed through the CLARIN Service Provider Federation.";;;"English";"Corpus query tools";;;"External";;;"Coats (2022)";"https://aclanthology.org/2022.alta-1.1/"

column1: SKell (SKetch Engine for language learners);"https://skell.sketchengine.eu/";"Querying/concordancing";"This is a simple tool for students and teachers of English to easily check whether or how a particular phrase or a word is used by real speakers of English.";;;"English

TXM;"https://groupes.renater.fr/wiki/txm-users/public/references_portails";"Querying/concordancing";"This tool corresponds to a number of different TXM portals running at various sites and with a number of different corpora. TXM offers online analysis tools for querying language corpora. The interface is in French. ";;;"French
CATMA;"http://catma.de/";"Querying/concordancing
column2: corpus upload and analysis";"The acronym CATMA stands forComputer Assisted Text Markup and Analysis.#SEPIt is possible to upload one's own corpus with this tool.";;;"German";"Corpus query tools";;;"External";;;;

column1: Webcorp;"https://www.webcorp.org.uk/live/";"Querying/concordancing";"This is a dedicated concordancing tool.";;;"Language independent";"Corpus query tools";;;"External";;;;

Webcorp Learn;"https://www.webcorp.org.uk/wcx/learn/";"Querying/concordancing";"This tool gives researchers access to a large collection (corpus) of newspaper articles spanning three decades. The tool has been created by linguists to encourage curiosity in language learners. WebCorp Learn promotes playful and context-based inductive learning and enables you to discover language through exploratory experimentation.#SEPRegistration is required.";;;"Language independent";"Corpus query tools";;;"External";;;;

Webcorp LSE (Linguist's Search Engine);"https://www.webcorp.org.uk/wcx/lse/";"Querying/concordancing";"This is a dedicated tool for the study of language on the web. The corpora were built by crawling the web and extracting textual content from web pages. Searches can be performed to find words
column4: wildcards and part-of-speech. Results are given as concordance lines in KWIC format. Post-search analyses are possible including time series
column6: sorting and summaries of meta-data from the matched web pages.#SEPIt is possible to upload one's own corpus with this tool.#SEPRegistration is required.";;;"Language independent";"Corpus query tools";;;"External";;;;

column1: I-Analyzer;"https://ianalyzer.hum.uu.nl/login?returnUrl=%2Fhome";"Querying/concordancing
column3: visualizations";"I-Analyzer allows searching and exploring text corpora
column5: and downloading tables of text and metadata for further analysis. I-Analyzer is open-source software and freely available.<ol>Presently
column6: it offers access to the following corpora: <li>Digital Library for Dutch Literature (DBNL)

column1: <li>Financial reports of Dutch companies
<li>Dutch Newspapers from the Royal Library: public dataset and full dataset (available upon request)
<li>Eighteenth Century Collections Online (available for Utrecht University users)
<li>Jewish Funerary Inscriptions
<li>Book reviews from Goodreads
<li>The Guardian-Observer newspaper archives (available for Utrecht University users)
<li>19th century UK Periodicals (available for Utrecht University users)
<li>Dutch court rulings
<li>Times newspaper archives (available for Utrecht University users)
<li>Dutch monarchs’ speeches

• Dutch parliamentary debates.
    • I-analyzer does not have an option to upload your own data yet. But you can still use your data with I-analyzer by self-hosting the tool or contacting the team (contact and self-host instructions).";;;"Multiple";"Corpus query tools";;;"External";;;;
